intro: Randia fusca, commonly known as the dark randia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, dark purple to black berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a slightly rough texture. Randia fusca typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth or along riverbanks.
